definition: lit. short-weaponed soldiery fight one another (idiom); fierce hand-to-hand infantry combat/to fight at close quarters
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: They closed with their enemy and started a fierce struggle.
sentences.chinese: 他们与敌人短兵相接，一场激战开始了。

sentences.english: Our soldiers grappled with the enemy at close range .
sentences.chinese: 我们的战士和敌人短兵相接地搏斗。

sentences.english: In modern naval warfare, men seldom fight hand to hand.
sentences.chinese: 在现代海战中，很少有短兵相接的场面。

sentences.english: For example, two ships are in close quarters situation.
sentences.chinese: 例如，两艘船在短兵相接的情况。

sentences.english: The two armies met face to face on the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 两军在战场上短兵相接。

sentences.english: On boarding enemy's vessel, the marines fought hand to hand.
sentences.chinese: 登上敌船后，水兵们短兵相接。

sentences.english: Closer and closer, your Knight took my Pawn.

definition: chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
to grapple (with the enemy)/to fight at the risk of one's life
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
